repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Libraries Schnaitter (WLN and Organization) Papers
did.abstract: Documents form the WSU Library from 1972-1978 regarding the Washington Libraries Network Council.

bioghist.p: The Washington State University Libraries date to the founding of the Washington Agricultural College and School of Science, when the library was just a shelf in the President’s office in the first campus building. It quickly grew and became a room in the original College Hall, then half a floor in the Administration Building (Thompson Hall), then half of Bryan Hall, then the full Holland Library, and then the Owen Science and Engineering Library as well. Over time a number of departmental libraries acted as branches of the system, some officially and some unofficially. The Washington Library Network was a group and program that helped with the automation of libraries across the state.

scopecontent.p: Documents from the WSU Libraries from 1972-1978. Includes files on the Washington Libraries Network (WLN) council documents, rules, and meetings. Also includes files on data processing and automation.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
Items in the front 2/3 of the box are filed into folders labeled by subject matter. The last 1/3 of the box is not contained in files and are in no particular order.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Libraries Schnaitter (WLN and Organization) Papers, 1972-1978 (UA1986-31)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Allene Schnaitter, Director of Libraries, of the Libraries Administration Office in October, 1986 and retained as UA1986-31.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
